intro: Restio stokoei, commonly known as the Stokoe's restio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants found in southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
